hackathon-description-text: Introducing SwampHacks: an 18-hour hackathon where the only objective is to make something AWESOME.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Assistant Professor at the University of Florida
Associate Chair of Research for the CISE Department at the University of Florida
Director of Software Development at Infinite Energy, Inc.

hackathon-eligibility: Any team of up to 5 participants who are physically in attendance of the event may submit a project.
hackathon-rules:
Submission for this event must be a software product or prototype thereof that must be original to the event. Projects that have been started prior to the start of hacking (8:00pm on 3/13/15) are 
for submission. Teams of up to five (5) participants may work on a single submission, but a participant can only be a part of one team.
In order to submit a project, you must have been onsite during development and the submission must be made onsite. Only those in attendance of SwampHacks may submit a project.
All submissions will be judged by the same panel of judges based on the following criteria: practical application, design (UI), creativity/novelty, quality of implementation, intuitiveness (UX), and the final pitch you give to the judges.
In order to submit, you should have 
 a name for your hack and a description for your hack. Posterboard will be supplied to all teams to create a presentation item for the demo fair. When the winners are announced, the top three teams will be expected to give a brief summary of their hack in front of all participants present.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A bluetooth smartwatch for the mobile user that just needs more mobility.
Microcontrollers for dummies. Oh the things you can build!
Laptop not small enough? Have a computer that can fit in the palm of your hand!
Touch the future. Make the future.
Amazon might not be able to make them work, but we can.
Learning doesn't have to end when the hacking does.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Big Nerd Ranch Programming Guides and Codeschool Subscriptions

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=University of Florida, Marston Science Library, Gainesville, FL 32603, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How easy and natural does using it feel?
How well did you convince the judges that your hack is the best?

hackathon-location-address: University of Florida, Marston Science Library, Gainesville, FL 32603, USA
hackathon-description-header: Unofficially and preemptively dubbed the greatest Hackathon, SwampHacks seeks to inspire all to come together to create. We welcome all students to attend and innovate!
